content:
OK so I figured out how to work YouTube and I even made a Lean Together 2025 playlist! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlF-CfQhukNlzXdQvu1SVt9vcD4--fLlg

All of today's talks are up, I can't promise I'll be as efficient every other day but I'll do my best!

Just wanted to say a big thank you to the organisers and contributors, especially for enabling asynchronous participation.
For a mix of work and family commitment reasons, I couldn't and can't attend many - maybe even any :sad: - talks live, so I really appreciate having the videos and have had a very pleasant afternoon bingeing yesterday's session.

Jan

Kevin Buzzard said:

OK so I figured out how to work YouTube and I even made a Lean Together 2025 playlist! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlF-CfQhukNlzXdQvu1SVt9vcD4--fLlg

All of today's talks are up, I can't promise I'll be as efficient every other day but I'll do my best!
Day 2 videos incoming on the leanprover-community YouTube channel. Sorry for the delay, my daughter is going back to university this week and I spent the evening with her.
On the schedule page, the YouTube playlist link incorrectly points to the 2024 playlist instead of the 2025 one.
Update: Fixed now.

@Jireh Loreaux or @Riccardo Brasca can either of you do something about Pietro's comment? There's an LT25 playlist. I've just clicked through to upload all the videos but I need to go to bed now (and several are still uploading), hopefully I got it mostly right.
It's already been fixed.
Thanks @Rob Lewis
Two of the second day’s talks are marked as “private” on YouTube. Will they become public later?
That sounds like my error, I'll fix them the moment I get to a computer!
Sorry, I didn't have time to check my work yesterday
I also noticed that the bv_decide one is still missing? Or is that one of the private ones (I don't know how to see private videos, why could you even see a video if it was private?!)
I'll take a look at this now

Yes apologies, two videos somehow didn't make it through, I left 8 videos processing and went to bed but two were still marked as "draft" when I woke up. Hopefully all 8 of Wednesday's talks are now available.
From what I can see on YouTube, the problem has been fixed. Thanks!

@Kevin Buzzard did you decide not to edit your "London Learning Lean" introduction?
https://youtu.be/4yLegqAU6W8?si=h0HYQ-GU91iqiF8Y ?

Things ended pretty late for me last night so I just stuck everything up on the internet on the basis that this was more important. I think there's a way to add popups somehow to youtube videos but I've been driving for 4 hours today and haven't got back to it yet, sorry.
As a quick fix, I guess you can just add a comment to the textual description of the video pointing out the error.

OK sorry for the delay. I don't know if you can edit videos once they're up on YT so I edited McKoen's video locally and re-uploaded; the link above is now broken and https://youtu.be/PHL4Ma3znmE?si=VCdzQ6cIzuqSHtMN is McKoen's talk
All Friday's talks should also be uploaded now -- let me know if I made any more errors!
@Kevin Buzzard, I don't see @David Ang's video in the playlist?
Similarly for @Leni Aniva.
Leni didn't want her talk to be recorded because she said that the information given in it will be out of date soon. David I'll have a look
David's was up there, I just failed to add it to the playlist. I'm doing everything manually so I can believe I've made more errors. At least there are 27 videos up there and 27 recorded talks.

Kevin Buzzard said:

Leni didn't want her talk to be recorded because she said that the information given in it will be out of date soon.

This is of course completely up to Leni, but it would be great to have this recording available for a few days (and then taken down a little later) for those of us in a time zone that made watching live difficult.
Unfortunately, I think there is no recording whatsoever, not just that it was not uploaded. Sorry, I don't believe we considered this possibility.
Whoops, Kevin's wording was quite clear, obviously you can't upload a recording that was never made!

Jireh Loreaux said:

Unfortunately, I think there is no recording whatsoever, not just that it was not uploaded. Sorry, I don't believe we considered this possibility.

When considering the options for recording, perhaps the options should include the option to record the session but only allow it to be distributed via the presenter. :smile:

That's an idea, although it could present some technical challenges (i.e., distribution of the recordings to the presenters, distribution from presenters to others, lack of a central access point for videos, etc.). We'll certainly keep this issue in mind for future iterations of Lean Together.
@Kevin Buzzard are you ok if I post about this and share the link to the playlist on our official Lean FRO socials (LinkedIn, Twitter and Mastodon, presently)?
Go for it!
Go for it!
Yes sure!
